trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Phone Silverlight apps
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Phone Silverlight apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with analytics and push notifications for Windows Phone Silverlight apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with analytics and push notifications for Windows Phone Silverlight apps.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Phone Silverlight apps
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Phone Silverlight apps

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Windows Universal
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: iOS - Obj C
trans-unit.target: iOS - Obj C

trans-unit.source: iOS - Swift
trans-unit.target: iOS - Swift

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: Cordova
trans-unit.target: Cordova

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users of a Windows Phone Silverlight application.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users of a Windows Phone Silverlight application.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: In it, you create a blank Windows Phone Silverlight app that collects basic data and receives push notifications using Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS).
trans-unit.target: In it, you create a blank Windows Phone Silverlight app that collects basic data and receives push notifications using Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS).

trans-unit.source: When you have completed this tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target-specific users based on their devices properties (using MPNS).
trans-unit.target: When you have completed this tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target-specific users based on their devices properties (using MPNS).

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight), refer to the [Windows Universal tutorial](mobile-engagement-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight), refer to the [Windows Universal tutorial](mobile-engagement-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.source: The [Mobile Engagement Windows Phone SDK]
trans-unit.target: The [Mobile Engagement Windows Phone SDK]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for Windows Phone Silverlight apps, and to complete it, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for Windows Phone Silverlight apps, and to complete it, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: Set up Mobile Engagement for your Windows Phone Silverlight app
trans-unit.target: Set up Mobile Engagement for your Windows Phone Silverlight app

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure portal, and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure portal, and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Services**, click **Mobile Engagement**, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Services**, click **Mobile Engagement**, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up that appears, enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up that appears, enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Application Name**: Type the name of your application.
trans-unit.target: **Application Name**: Type the name of your application.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to use any character.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to use any character.

trans-unit.source: **Platform**: Select the target platform (**Windows Phone Silverlight**) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).
trans-unit.target: **Platform**: Select the target platform (**Windows Phone Silverlight**) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).

trans-unit.source: **Application Resource Name**: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.
trans-unit.target: **Application Resource Name**: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.

trans-unit.source: You must only use conventional URL characters.
trans-unit.target: You must only use conventional URL characters.

trans-unit.source: The auto-generated name should provide you a strong basis.
trans-unit.target: The auto-generated name should provide you a strong basis.

trans-unit.source: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash as this name must be unique.
trans-unit.target: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash as this name must be unique.

trans-unit.source: **Location**: Select the datacenter where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: **Location**: Select the datacenter where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: **Collection**: If you have already created an application, select a previously created Collection; otherwise select **New Collection**.
trans-unit.target: **Collection**: If you have already created an application, select a previously created Collection; otherwise select **New Collection**.

trans-unit.source: **Collection Name**: This represents your group of applications.
trans-unit.target: **Collection Name**: This represents your group of applications.

trans-unit.source: It also ensures that all your apps are in a group that allows aggregated calculations of metrics.
trans-unit.target: It also ensures that all your apps are in a group that allows aggregated calculations of metrics.

trans-unit.source: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.
trans-unit.target: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.

trans-unit.source: Select the app you just created in the **Applications** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the app you just created in the **Applications** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connection Info** to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connection Info** to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Connection String** - This is what you will need to identify this app in your application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your Phone app.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Connection String** - This is what you will need to identify this app in your application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your Phone app.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: This tutorial presents a "basic integration", which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial presents a "basic integration", which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.

trans-unit.source: The complete integration documentation can be found in the [Mobile Engagement Windows Phone SDK] documentation.
trans-unit.target: The complete integration documentation can be found in the [Mobile Engagement Windows Phone SDK] documentation.

trans-unit.source: We will create a basic app with Visual Studio to demonstrate the integration.
trans-unit.target: We will create a basic app with Visual Studio to demonstrate the integration.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Windows Phone Silverlight project
trans-unit.target: Create a new Windows Phone Silverlight project

trans-unit.source: Start Visual Studio, and in the **Home** screen, select **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: Start Visual Studio, and in the **Home** screen, select **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up, select **Store Apps** -> **Windows Phone Apps** -> **Blank App (Windows Phone Silverlight)**.
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up, select **Store Apps** -> **Windows Phone Apps** -> **Blank App (Windows Phone Silverlight)**.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the app `Name` and `Solution name`, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the app `Name` and `Solution name`, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to target either **Windows Phone 8.0** or **Windows Phone 8.1**.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to target either **Windows Phone 8.0** or **Windows Phone 8.1**.

trans-unit.source: You have now created a new Windows Phone Silverlight app into which we will integrate the Azure Mobile Engagement SDK.
trans-unit.target: You have now created a new Windows Phone Silverlight app into which we will integrate the Azure Mobile Engagement SDK.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: Install the [Mobile Engagement Windows Phone SDK] nuget package in your project.
trans-unit.target: Install the [Mobile Engagement Windows Phone SDK] nuget package in your project.

trans-unit.source: Open `WMAppManifest.xml` (under the Properties folder) and make sure the following are declared (add them if they are not) in the `<Capabilities />` tag:
trans-unit.target: Open `WMAppManifest.xml` (under the Properties folder) and make sure the following are declared (add them if they are not) in the `<Capabilities />` tag:

trans-unit.source: Now paste the connection string that you copied earlier for your Mobile Engagement app and paste it in the `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file, between the `<connectionString>` and `</connectionString>` tags:
trans-unit.target: Now paste the connection string that you copied earlier for your Mobile Engagement app and paste it in the `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file, between the `<connectionString>` and `</connectionString>` tags:

trans-unit.source: In the `App.xaml.cs` file:
trans-unit.target: In the `App.xaml.cs` file:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Add the `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: Add the `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Initialize the SDK in the `Application_Launching` method:
trans-unit.target: Initialize the SDK in the `Application_Launching` method:

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Insert the following in the `Application_Activated`:
trans-unit.target: Insert the following in the `Application_Activated`:

trans-unit.source: Enable real-time monitoring
trans-unit.target: Enable real-time monitoring

trans-unit.source: In order to start sending data and ensuring that the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.
trans-unit.target: In order to start sending data and ensuring that the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.

trans-unit.source: We will achieve this by subclassing our `MainPage` with the `EngagementPage`, which the Mobile Engagement SDK provides.
trans-unit.target: We will achieve this by subclassing our `MainPage` with the `EngagementPage`, which the Mobile Engagement SDK provides.

trans-unit.source: Add the `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: Add the `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: Replace the super class of **MainPage**, which is before **PhoneApplicationPage**, with **EngagementPage**, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Replace the super class of **MainPage**, which is before **PhoneApplicationPage**, with **EngagementPage**, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: In your `MainPage.xml` file:
trans-unit.target: In your `MainPage.xml` file:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Add to your namespaces declarations:
trans-unit.target: Add to your namespaces declarations:

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Replace `phone:PhoneApplicationPage` in the XML tag name with `engagement:EngagementPage`.
trans-unit.target: Replace `phone:PhoneApplicationPage` in the XML tag name with `engagement:EngagementPage`.

trans-unit.source: Ensure your app is connected with real-time monitoring
trans-unit.target: Ensure your app is connected with real-time monitoring

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using the Mobile Engagement real-time monitoring feature.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using the Mobile Engagement real-time monitoring feature.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: From your Azure portal, ensure that you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: From your Azure portal, ensure that you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: You will land in the **Settings** page of your Engagement portal for your app.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the **Settings** page of your Engagement portal for your app.

trans-unit.source: From there, click the **Monitor** tab, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: From there, click the **Monitor** tab, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in real time, that will start your app.
trans-unit.target: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in real time, that will start your app.

trans-unit.source: Back in Visual Studio, start your app either in the emulator or in a connected device.
trans-unit.target: Back in Visual Studio, start your app either in the emulator or in a connected device.

trans-unit.source: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor!
trans-unit.target: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor!

trans-unit.source: **Congratulations!** You succeeded in completing the first step of this tutorial with an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend, which is already sending data.
trans-unit.target: **Congratulations!** You succeeded in completing the first step of this tutorial with an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend, which is already sending data.

trans-unit.source: Enable push notifications and in-app messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable push notifications and in-app messaging

trans-unit.source: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact and reach your users with Push Notifications and in-app Messaging in the context of campaigns.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact and reach your users with Push Notifications and in-app Messaging in the context of campaigns.

trans-unit.source: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: The following sections set up your app to receive them.
trans-unit.target: The following sections set up your app to receive them.

trans-unit.source: Enable your app to receive MPNS Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: Enable your app to receive MPNS Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Add new Capabilities to your `WMAppManifest.xml` file:
trans-unit.target: Add new Capabilities to your `WMAppManifest.xml` file:

trans-unit.source: Initialize the REACH SDK
trans-unit.target: Initialize the REACH SDK

trans-unit.source: In `App.xaml.cs`, call `EngagementReach.Instance.Init();` in the **Application_Launching** function, right after the agent initialization:
trans-unit.target: In `App.xaml.cs`, call `EngagementReach.Instance.Init();` in the **Application_Launching** function, right after the agent initialization:

trans-unit.source: In `App.xaml.cs`, call `EngagementReach.Instance.OnActivated(e);` in the **Application_Activated** function, right after the agent initialization:
trans-unit.target: In `App.xaml.cs`, call `EngagementReach.Instance.OnActivated(e);` in the **Application_Activated** function, right after the agent initialization:

trans-unit.source: You're all set.
trans-unit.target: You're all set.

trans-unit.source: Now we will verify that you have correctly cried out this basic integration.
trans-unit.target: Now we will verify that you have correctly cried out this basic integration.

trans-unit.source: Send a notification to your app
trans-unit.target: Send a notification to your app

trans-unit.source: We will now create a simple push notification campaign that sends a push notification to our app.
trans-unit.target: We will now create a simple push notification campaign that sends a push notification to our app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **REACH** tab in your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **REACH** tab in your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **New announcement** to create your push campaign.
trans-unit.target: Click **New announcement** to create your push campaign.

trans-unit.source: Set up the first field of your campaign through the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Set up the first field of your campaign through the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Name your campaign with any name you like.
trans-unit.target: Name your campaign with any name you like.

trans-unit.source: As **Delivery time**, select *Any time* to allow the app to receive a notification whether the app is started or not.
trans-unit.target: As **Delivery time**, select *Any time* to allow the app to receive a notification whether the app is started or not.

trans-unit.source: In the notification text, type the title, which will be in bold in the push.
trans-unit.target: In the notification text, type the title, which will be in bold in the push.

trans-unit.source: Then type your message.
trans-unit.target: Then type your message.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down, and in the **Content** section, select **Notification only**.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down, and in the **Content** section, select **Notification only**.

trans-unit.source: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible.
trans-unit.target: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible.

trans-unit.source: Now scroll down again and click the **Create** button to save your campaign.
trans-unit.target: Now scroll down again and click the **Create** button to save your campaign.

trans-unit.source: Last step: Click **Activate** to activate your campaign and send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Last step: Click **Activate** to activate your campaign and send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Now you should see a notification on your device, **Congratulations!**:
trans-unit.target: Now you should see a notification on your device, **Congratulations!**:
